(High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [Resource Exhaustion] Does setting max_decoding_message_size(usize::MAX) allow an attacker to send arbitrarily large messages that consume all available memory, causing OOM crashes on indexer nodes? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [Panic/Availability] The function uses .unwrap() which will panic if all retry attempts fail - can an attacker trigger network conditions that guarantee panic, causing indexer service unavailability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [URL Validation] Is there validation on the input URL to prevent SSRF attacks where an attacker could make the indexer connect to internal services or localhost by providing malicious URLs? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [Compression Bomb] Does accepting Zstd and Gzip compression without size limits expose the system to compression bomb attacks where small compressed payloads decompress to massive sizes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [Configuration Mismatch] Can mismatched compression settings between client and server (send_compressed vs accept_compressed) lead to data corruption or failed transaction processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_grpc_client()] [Backoff Manipulation] Does the default ExponentialBackoff configuration have appropriate jitter and max_interval settings to prevent thundering herd problems when multiple clients reconnect simultaneously? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: create_data_service_grpc_client()] [Resource Exhaustion] Similar to create_grpc_client, does setting max_decoding_message_size(usize::MAX) allow unbounded memory consumption from malicious data service responses? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/lib.rs] [Function: timestamp_now_proto()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Since this function captures current time without any verification, can an attacker exploit TOCTOU race conditions in timestamp-dependent operations? (Low)
